public class FIFOQUEUE extends Object implements IQueuable
First-in first-out queue

  • Constructor Details

    • FIFOQUEUE

      public FIFOQUEUE​(int capacity)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      capacity - the size of Queue

  • Method Details

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Is the Queue full? Returns true if the current Queue has reached its capacity. This is to prevent adding new values to the Queue.
      Returns:
      true if and only if number of values in Queue is equal to capacity of Queue

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Is the Queue empty? Returns true if the current Queue has no values in it.
      Returns:
      true if and only if there are no values in Queue.

    • enqueue

      public String[] enqueue​(String value)
      Add an item to the Queue. Throws an error message if Queue is full.
      Specified by:
      enqueue in interface IQueuable
      Parameters:
      value - the value to add
      Returns:
      new queue
      See Also:
      IQueuable.enqueue(String)

    • dequeue

      public String dequeue()
      Removes first item from Queue. Handles empty Queue.
      Specified by:
      dequeue in interface IQueuable
      Returns:
      the item removed, or an error message telling user the Queue is empty.
      See Also:
      IQueuable.dequeue()

    • getQueue

      public String[] getQueue()
      Get a copy of the current Queue. Does not return null item.
      Specified by:
      getQueue in interface IQueuable
      Returns:
      list filtering all null items in the Queue
      See Also:
      IQueuable.getQueue()

    • size

      public int size()
      Get the number of items in the Queue.
      Specified by:
      size in interface IQueuable
      Returns:
      number of items in queue
      See Also:
      IQueuable.size()

    • printQueue

      public void printQueue()
      Prints the whole Queue including null values. For debugging use only.
